<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I'm seeing some issues with the kernel returned by the call kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d() <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d(5, 0., 0.) kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d(3, 215., -0.5)
<denchmark-h:h2>What I am seeing</denchmark-h>
>>> kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d(5, 0., 0.) tensor([[[nan, nan, nan, nan, nan], [nan, nan, nan, nan, nan], [inf, inf, nan, -inf, -inf], [nan, nan, nan, nan, nan], [nan, nan, nan, nan, nan]]]) >>> kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d(3, 215., -0.5) tensor([[[-0.0000, -0.0000, -0.3333], [-0.0000, 0.3333, -0.0000], [ 1.0000, -0.0000, -0.0000]]]) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
According to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/master/kornia/filters/kernels.py#L634>https://github.com/kornia/kornia/blob/master/kornia/filters/kernels.py#L634</denchmark-link> , I would expect >>> kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d(5, 0., 0.) tensor([[0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000], [0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000], [0.2000, 0.2000, 0.2000, 0.2000, 0.2000], [0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000], [0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000, 0.0000]]) >>> kornia.filters.get_motion_kernel2d(3, 215., -0.5) tensor([[0.0000, 0.0412, 0.0732], [0.1920, 0.3194, 0.0804], [0.2195, 0.0743, 0.0000]]) <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>

I am seeing this issue on both mac and linux, both with pytorch 1.7 and kornia 0.4.1
